New Records: The Oklahoma City Thunder earned their 13th consecutive NBA victory, marking their longest winning streak since the franchise moved to Oklahoma City.
Key Match Events: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 29 points and Jalen Williams added 18 to help the Thunder secure the win.
Oklahoma City forced seven turnovers in the third quarter and turned those into 17 points, outscoring the Clippers 42-20 in the frame.
Amir Coffey led Los Angeles with a season-high 26 points.
The Clippers' leading scorer, Norman Powell, missed his first 10 shots and finished with a season-low six points on 1-of-11 shooting.
Post-Match Reflections: Thunder coach Mark Daigneault sat Shai Gilgeous-Alexander for the entire fourth quarter on the first night of a back-to-back.
The Thunder will look to win their 14th straight game on Friday against the New York Knicks.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Los Angeles was missing James Harden due to right groin soreness, marking his second missed game of the season.
